HeroGame

Class GameManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • HeroGame.GameManager

  • public class GameManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Game Manager Class for Heroes & Villains Game Includes main() for GUI game SENG201 2018S1
    Author:
    Andy Holden & Alex Liggett

        public void closeCityScreen(CityScreen cityScreen,
                            City city,
                            Direction direction,
                            Hero hero)
        Remotely closes a CityScreen for Battle
        Parameters:
        cityScreen - the CityScreen to close
        city - the current City
        direction - the Direction of the VillainsLair from which the CityScreen is closed
        hero - the Hero chosen for the current Battle

      • launchBattleScreen

        public void launchBattleScreen(Hero player,
                               City city,
                               Direction direction)
        Launches a BattleScreen
        Parameters:
        player - a Hero the Hero chosen for this battle
        city - a City the current City
        direction - a Direction the direction of the VillainsLair from which this battle will be launched

      • closeBattleScreen

        public void closeBattleScreen(BattleScreen battleScreen,
                              City city,
                              Direction direction)
        Remotely closes a BattleScreen. Used if Villain/Hero defeated or Hero retreats
        Parameters:
        battleScreen - the BattleScreen to be closed
        city - a City the City to return to
        direction - a Direction the Direction to be returned to

      • launchFinalScreen

        public void launchFinalScreen(java.lang.String outcome)
        Launches a FinalScreen being the screen where win/lose/credits are displayed
        Parameters:
        outcome - a String denoting win or lose

      • launchVendorScreen

        public void launchVendorScreen(Direction direction,
                               City city,
                               Shop shop,
                               CityScreen cityScreen)
        Launches a VendorScreen, the screen where items are purchased in the shop
        Parameters:
        direction - the Direction within the city from where the screen is launched, and to which it will return on close
        city - the City currently being played
        shop - a Shop class which provides most of the methods required in this location
        cityScreen - the CityScreen from which the VendorScreen is launched

      • closeVendorScreen

        public void closeVendorScreen(VendorScreen vendor,
                              City city,
                              Direction direction)
        Remotely closes a VendorScreen and creates a new CityScreen
        Parameters:
        vendor - the VendorScreen to be closed
        city - the City currently being played
        direction - the direction in which the shop is located within the current city
